title: librechat fails to start due to permissions on /app/start_librechat.sh
body:
```
harbor$ harbor up librechat --remove-orphans
[+] Running 7/8
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-vector  Starte...                                     0.4s 
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-db      Started                                       0.4s 
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-search  Starte...                                     0.4s 
 ✔ Container harbor.ollama            Healthy                                       0.6s 
 ✔ Container harbor.webui             Running                                       0.0s 
 ✔ Container harbor.ollama-init       Started                                       0.8s 
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-rag     Started                                       0.5s 
 ⠴ Container harbor.librechat         Starting                                      0.8s 
Error response from daemon: failed to create task for container: failed to create shim task: OCI runtime create failed: runc create failed: unable to start container process: error during container init: exec: "/app/start_librechat.sh": permission denied: unknown

harbor$ harbor shell librechat sh
[+] Creating 4/4
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-db      Running                                       0.0s 
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-vector  Runnin...                                     0.0s 
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-search  Runnin...                                     0.0s 
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-rag     Created                                       0.0s 
[+] Running 1/1
 ✔ Container harbor.librechat-rag  Started                                          0.2s 

/app $ ls -l /app/start_librechat.sh 
-rw-r-----    1 node     node           617 Jan 25 18:47 /app/start_librechat.sh
```

Setting the permissions on that file doesn't seem to help.

```
$ ls -l librechat/start_librechat.sh 
-rwxr-xr-x 1 user user 617 Jan 25 11:47 librechat/start_librechat.sh
```
author: papamoose

comments.body: Hey OP did 'harbor fixfs' help or are you saying that's a command you already tried?
@ColumbusAI That seems to have worked. Thank you. Closing.
